newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - April 1.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
The government has decided to take stern action against those manpower agents who have illegally sent Bangladeshi people to Malaysia.
Opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP leader Begum Khaleda Zia on Monday gave a seven-day ultimatum to the government to arrest the killers of two of her party workers in Feni district.

The 12th meeting of the foreign ministers' meeting of the Non-alligned Movement (NAM), scheduled from April 4 to 8 in New Delhi, will mainly discuss the issues relating to the reorganisation of the United Nations.
The government has decided to distribute the state-owned land among the landless people across the country.
Armed tribals stormed a remote rural market in the hilly Bandarban district on Sunday evening and looted goods and cash from about hundred shops.
Foreign Minister Abdus Samad Azad leaves for Seoul on Tuesday in quest of Korean investment and jobs for Bangladesh.
World Bank's Resident Mission chief Pierre Landell Mills said on Monday Bangladesh capital market earned the reputation as a problem area, shying away foreign portfolio investors.
The government has taken steps for creating natural park and sanctuary for birds. REUTER
